SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.alee.utils.swing
Class Timer

java.lang.Object
  com.alee.utils.swing.Timer
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComponentUpdater
public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a small replacement for standart javax.swing.Timer. Instead of running in a single queue it creates separate Threads for each timer and does not affect event-dispatching thread, until events are dispatched. This basically means that you can use any number of Timer instances and you can run them alltogether without having any issues.

Also this Timer implementation offers a variety of additional features and improvements which standard timer doesn't have (for example you can dispatch events in a separate non-EDT thread and as a result avoid using EDT at all).

Since:
1.3
Author:
Mikle Garin
